title: Grieving parents plead with US diplomat's wife to be 'humane' over son's death
text:

The grieving parents of a British teenager killed in a motorbike crash have pleaded with an American diplomat's wife to return to the UK.

Harry Dunn, 19, tragically died in a head on collision with a car close to RAF Croughton, an American spy base in Northamptonshire, back in August.

Anne Sacoolas, the wife of a US diplomat, is suspected to have pulled out onto the wrong side of the road during the fatal accident.

Harry's parents, Charlotte Charles and Tim Dunn, are pleading with Ms Sacoolas to be "humane and kind" and return to the UK after fleeing the country and claiming diplomatic immunity.

Speaking on today's This Morning, emotional Charlotte revealed they want justice and will even fly to the US to get answers if they have to.

(Image: ITV)

(Image: Universal News (Europe))

Charlotte admitted they were "shocked" when they found out Ms Sacoolas had fled the country and "angry" they did not get informed much sooner.

She said: "Not only from mother to mother but from a set of parents to anther set of parents. Why did they think it was kind or humane to get on a plane and flee? That's what we're struggling to understand.

"We know, and all the support we’ve had which is global now, they can’t understand why you would just flee."

(Image: SKY)

(Image: ITV)

When asked what she would like to happen next, Harry's mum said: "It's going to take quite a long time. Until hopefully we have the chance to meet her and try to talk about it. See her remorse.

"Why she was feeling it was the right thing to go."

Tim added: "She knew Harry had died. She was told that. I really struggle to understand you know your killed somebody and you think the right decision is to flee the country.

"It doesn’t make sense to me how anybody can see that was the way to go."

(Image: ITV)

(Image: Justice4Harry)

They admitted they don't necessarily want Ms Sacoolas behind bars but do want to get justice for their late son.

Charlotte said: "We don’t want to take her away from being a mum. We said to our police force we would work with them.

"They were going for death by dangerous driving. We agreed to reduce it to death by careless driving so we’d get justice but she’d get a suspended sentence and continue being a mum. She’s had six weeks now to come forward.

"You’d think human to human she’d actually have the decency to say 'let me go. Release me from this diplomatic immunity. I want to go and see them'. That's probably our best hope at the moment."

(Image: Justice4Harry)

(Image: ITV)

Tim and Charlotte are pleased that Prime Minister Boris Johnson has promised to speak personally to US President Donald Trump .

Harry's dad said: "I’m hoping with the pressure from our Prime Minister if they look at the case and reassess what diplomatic immunity means."

Admitting there needs to be an overhaul in the law, Charlotte added: "We can’t let it happen again. She’s taken our son."

*This Morning airs weekdays on ITV at 10.30am
description: The parents of Harry Dunn, who was tragically killed in a motorbike crash, will fly out to America if Anne Sacoolas doesn't return to the UK
